string.value: Went to Chil Sung and told him that Chil Nam said something about a fox and Chil Sung tells of a Samiho living in Kamak Mountain. The Samiho may hold more clues. Let's go and hunt down a #rSamiho#k.

Retrieved a strange piece of cloth after hunting a Samiho and showed it to Chil Sung. He is suddenly surprised, and says this is a piece of the Kamak Mountain's God of Mountains. Why do the Samihos have the god's cloth? Let's hurry and meet with the #bGod of Mountains#k.

How is Chil Nam? I hope he is getting better. What? He said something about a fox? A fox... maybe Chil Nam was attacked by Samihoes from the Kamak Mountain? He actually did go to Kamak Mountain for wood before.
Still, I haven't heard of people losing their minds because of a Samiho. Would you mind going to Kamak Mountain and investigate the Samihoes yourself? They may hold the key to the problem.
Please come back if you find anything while hunting down #rSamihoes#k. We will eventually find a way to cure Chil Nam if we work together.
Indeed... I don't blame you. Samihoes are not any ordinary creature. Sorry to have bothered you.
Have you gotten any clues? What... This? This cloth was from a Samiho? This can't be from a villager, because no body goes anywhere near Fox Valley. It's too dangerous.

A piece of soft cloth... the only villagers who would wear something like this are Park Cheomji and Nolbu. It can't be either of them, because they don't leave the village. Then who could this cloth belong to? Hmm...

It can't be... there is one other! Rather, a spirit wears something like this outside of the village. The Guardian Spirit! He always wears this fabric. But... why would a Samiho carry a piece of the Guardian Spirit's cloth? We'd better go and ask.
Seems as though you haven't gotten any clues from the #rSamihoes#k. We might get something if we hunt them down.
